intro: Cynometra aubrevillei, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, elongated fruits containing flat, edible seeds. It is valued for its hard, heavy wood used in furniture and construction, though it is also threatened by habitat loss. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native forests, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
